questions.question_text:
A developer created a process with the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework, uploaded the package on the Orchestrator, and created a job for it. Once these steps are performed, the job is started from the Orchestrator and begins to process transactions. After two processed transactions, the job is stopped from Orchestrator.
At which point in the workflow will this job stop?

choices.A: After the currently running workflow is executed because the stop command is propagated to the robot and the execution will be ended.
choices.B: Next time the Get Transaction Data state is executed, the stop command is detected and the execution transitions to the End Process state.
choices.D: After the current transaction is finished, the Process Transaction state will detect the stop command and transitions to the End Process state.
choices.C: Immediately, because the stop command is propagated to the robot and the execution will be ended.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Next time the Get Transaction Data state is executed, the stop command is detected and the execution transitions to the End Process state.

Selected Answer: B
la señal s everifica siempre en el estado de get transaction
Ans : B
Selected Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
The logic would be that after the successful execution of the second transaction, it goes to set transaction status in Success, then returns to Get Transaction data to process a third transaction, but an error occurs and then it stops in Get Transaction Data, an error occurs and go to End Process.

Selected Answer: B
ShouldStop is in Get Transaction Data
Given Ans is correct

Selected Answer: B
Tested !

questions.question_text: While working with a queue in Orchestrator, you notice that the status of one of the Queue Items has changed to Abandoned. What was the status before it changed to Abandoned?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. In Progress
Ans : B

Selected Answer: B
Abandoned - the item remained in the In Progress status for a long period of time (approx. 24 hours) without being processed;

comments.content: Retried - the item failed with an application exception and was retried. After the Robot finishes retrying the item, the status changes to Failed or Successful, according to your workflow.
how about if the status is retried whats the original state?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Abandoned - the item remained in the In Progress status for a long period of time (approx. 24 hours) without being processed;
ıt wll be in progress

choices.B: Check the Private property on all activities that reference the password variable
choices.C: Store the temporary password in an Excel file that the process can access
choices.A: Ensure the password variable is of the SecureString variable type
choices.D: Check the Isolated property when invoking a workflow with the password variable

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Ensure the password variable is of the SecureString variable type

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
must be credential type !

Selected Answer: A

questions.question_text: A developer is creating an automation project which creates a temporary password in the company’s system for new employees and later enters it into a desktop application. To protect this sensitive information, how can the developer avoid the password from being displayed on screen when it is entered into the desktop application?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Activate
Ans : A

Selected Answer: A
Activate property should be enabled

Selected Answer: A
Activate property brings it to the foreground

Selected Answer: A
If selected, the specified UI element is brought to the foreground and activated before the text is typed in.

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.uipath.com/activities/other/latest/user-guide/n-type-into

questions.question_text: A developer is planning to automate the process of typing values into a web form. Each field must be brought to the foreground before the data is typed into each field. Which Type Into activity property should be configured?
